node.title: Army veteran falls to his death trying to climb Mount Whitney
node.description: Searchers using an avalanche probe found Eric Goepfert's body "under deep snow" at the base of the Ebersbacher Ledges.
node.content: ["Altitude sickness and severe storm conditions likely caused an Army veteran to fall to his death while trying to climb Mount Whitney in the eastern Sierra Nevada, authorities said Tuesday.", "The Inyo County Sheriff's Office said in a statement\u00a0that Eric Goepfert, 50, had planned a five-day, four-night trip in the backcountry. His wife called the sheriff's office when he didn't come home as planned Dec. 17.", "Two days later, searchers using an avalanche probe found Goepfert's body \"under deep snow\" at the base of the Ebersbacher Ledges.", "Investigators said they believe Goepfert was experiencing headache and nausea, which are symptoms of acute mountain sickness. Two major storms also ripped through the eastern part of the Sierra mountain range and the snow, high winds, and single-digit temperatures likely caused him to fall 30 feet, they said.", "Goepfert served in the U.S. Army from the age of 18 and was an active Army reservist, the sheriff's office said..", "Whitney lies on the boundary of Sequoia National Park and Inyo National Forest and is the most frequently climbed peak in the Sierra Nevada, according to the National Park Service.", "It rises to around 14,500 feet and is the tallest peak in the U.S. outside of Alaska.", "The mountain has claimed several lives over the years.", "In April, Saulo Sifuentes Escalante, 36, of Conroe, Texas fell to his death during a day hike to the peak.\u00a0 Last year, Cassandra Bravo, a nurse and single mother of two,\u00a0died after an accident while hiking the mountain.", "In 2017, a 75-year-old community college professor from Texas fell to his death on the mountain and in 2018, two people died in separate falls.", "For Breaking News & Analysis Download the Free CBS News app"]
